member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.GetMe
member.summary: A simple method for testing your bot's auth token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of User object.
member.returns: Returns basic information about the bot in form of object

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.GetUpdates(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling.
member.param: Optional. Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as GetUpdates is called with an offset higher than its Id.
Optional. Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100
Optional. Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling
member.remarks: 1. This method will not work if an outgoing webhook is set up. 2. In order to avoid getting duplicate updates, recalculate offset after each server response.
member.returns: An Array of Update objects is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SetWebhook(System.String,System.Nullable{Telegram.Bot.Types.FileToSend})
member.summary: Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts.
member.param: Optional. HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration
Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked
member.remarks: 1. You will not be able to receive updates using getUpdates for as long as an outgoing webhook is set up. 2. We currently do not support self-signed certificates. 3. For the moment, the only supported port for Webhooks is 443. We may support additional ports later.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendMessage(Telegram.Bot.Types.MessageType,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Use this method to send any messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: The
Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
The content of the message. Could be a text, photo, audio, sticker, document, video or location
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
Optional. if additional Parameters could bei send i.e. "disable_web_page_preview" in for a TextMessage
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendTextMessage(System.Int64,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup,Telegram.Bot.Types.ParseMode)
member.summary: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Text of the message to be sent
Optional. Disables link previews for links in this message
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
Optional. Change, if you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in your bot's message.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendTextMessage(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup,Telegram.Bot.Types.ParseMode)
member.summary: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
Text of the message to be sent
Optional. Disables link previews for links in this message
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
Optional. Change, if you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in your bot's message.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendPhoto(System.Int64,Telegram.Bot.Types.FileToSend,System.String,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup)
member.summary: Use this method to send photos. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Photo to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend a photo that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new photo using multipart/form-data.
Optional. Photo caption (may also be used when resending photos by file_id).
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendAudio(System.Int64,Telegram.Bot.Types.FileToSend,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup)
member.summary: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display them in the music player. Your audio must be in the .mp3 format. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Audio file to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend an audio that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new audio file using multipart/form-data.
Duration of the audio in seconds
Performer
Track name
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendAudio(System.String,Telegram.Bot.Types.FileToSend,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup)

Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
member.param: Username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
Audio file to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend an audio that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new audio file using multipart/form-data.
Duration of the audio in seconds
Performer
Track name
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendAudio(System.Int64,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup)
member.summary: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .ogg file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can send audio files of up to 50 MB in size.
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Audio file to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend an audio that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new audio file using multipart/form-data.
Duration of the audio in seconds
Performer
Track name
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

Bots can send audio files of up to 50 MB in size.

Duration of sent video in seconds
Video caption
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendVoice(System.Int64,Telegram.Bot.Types.FileToSend,System.Int32,System.Int32,Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup)
member.summary: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .ogg file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Audio or Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Audio file to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend an audio that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new audio file using multipart/form-data.
Duration of sent audio in seconds
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

Duration of sent audio in seconds
Optional. If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
Optional. Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for a custom reply keyboard, instructions to hide keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
member.returns: On success, the sent Message is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendChatAction(System.Int64,Telegram.Bot.Types.ChatAction)
member.summary: Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status).
member.param: Unique identifier for the target chat
Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive.
member.remarks: We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.SendChatAction(System.String,Telegram.Bot.Types.ChatAction)
member.summary: Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status).
member.param: Username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive.
member.remarks: We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.GetUserProfilePhotos(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.
member.param: Unique identifier of the target user
Optional. Sequential number of the first photo to be returned. By default, all photos are returned.
Optional. Limits the number of photos to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.GetFile(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading. For the moment, bots can download files of up to 20MB in size.
member.param: File identifier
The destination stream
member.returns: The File object. If destination is empty stream ist embedded in the File Object

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Api.AnswerInlineQuery(System.String,Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult[],System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Use this method to send answers to an inline query.
member.param: Unique identifier for answered query
A array of results for the inline query
Optional. The maximum amount of time in seconds the result of the inline query may be cached on the server
Optional. Pass True, if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

Optional. Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don‘t support pagination. Offset length can’t exceed 64 bytes.
member.returns: On success, True is returned.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Helpers.Extensions.FromUnixTime(System.Int64)
member.summary: Convert a long into a DateTime

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Helpers.Extensions.ToUnixTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert a DateTime into a long

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Helpers.UnixDateTimeConverter.WriteJson(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonWriter,System.Object,Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer)
member.summary: Writes the JSON representation of the object.
member.param: The to write to.
The value.
The calling serializer.

member.name: M:Telegram.Bot.Helpers.UnixDateTimeConverter.ReadJson(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader,System.Type,System.Object,Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer)
member.summary: Reads the JSON representation of the object.
member.param: The to read from.
Type of the object.
The existing value of object being read.
The calling serializer.
member.returns: The object value.

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Audio

member.summary: Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

member.summary: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat
member.summary: This object represents a chat.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for this chat, not exceeding 1e13 by absolute value

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.Type
member.summary: Type of chat, can be either "Private", or "Group", or "Channel"

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.Title
member.summary: Optional. Title, for channels and group chats

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.Username
member.summary: Optional. Username, for private chats and channels if available

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.FirstName
member.summary: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Chat.LastName
member.summary: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChatAction
member.summary: Type of action the Bot is performing

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChatType
member.summary: Type of a Chat

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChosenInlineResult
member.summary: This object represents a result of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChosenInlineResult.ResultId
member.summary: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChosenInlineResult.From
member.summary: The user that chose the result.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ChosenInlineResult.Query
member.summary: The query that was used to obtain the result.

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Contact
member.summary: This object represents a phone contact.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Contact.PhoneNumber
member.summary: Contact's phone number

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Contact.FirstName
member.summary: Contact's first name

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Contact.LastName
member.summary: Optional. Contact's last name

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Contact.UserId
member.summary: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Document
member.summary: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos and audio files).

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Document.Thumb
member.summary: Document thumbnail as defined by sender

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Document.FileName
member.summary: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Document.MimeType
member.summary: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.File
member.summary: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot{token}/{file_path}. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.File.FileId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this file

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.File.FileSize
member.summary: Optional. File size, if known

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.File.FilePath
member.summary: File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot{token}/{file_path} to get the file.

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ForceReply
member.summary: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ForceReply.Force
member.summary: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQuery
member.summary: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQuery.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for this query

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQuery.From
member.summary: Sender

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQuery.Query
member.summary: Text of the query

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQuery.Offset
member.summary: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier of this result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.Type
member.summary: Type of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.Title
member.summary: Title of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.MessageText
member.summary: Text of a message to be sent

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.ParseMode
member.summary: Optional. If you want Telegram apps to show bold, italic, fixed-width text or inline URLs in your bot's message.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.ThumbUrl
member.summary: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResult.DisableWebPagePreview
member.summary: Optional. Disables link previews for links in the sent message

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle
member.summary: Represents a link to an article or web page.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.Title
member.summary: Title of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.MessageText
member.summary: Text of a message to be sent

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.ThumbUrl
member.summary: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.Url
member.summary: Optional. URL of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.HideUrl
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you don't want the URL to be shown in the message

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.Description
member.summary: Optional. Short description of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.ThumbWidth
member.summary: Optional. Thumbnail width

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultArticle.ThumbHeight
member.summary: Optional. Thumbnail height

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultGif
member.summary: Represents a link to an animated GIF file. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can provide message_text to send it instead of the animation.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultGif.Url
member.summary: A valid URL for the GIF file. File size must not exceed 1MB

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultGif.Width
member.summary: Optional. Width of the GIF

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultGif.Height
member.summary: Optional. Height of the GIF

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultGif.Caption
member.summary: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
member.summary: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound). By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can provide message_text to send it instead of the animation.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.Url
member.summary: A valid URL for the MP4 file. File size must not exceed 1MB

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.Width
member.summary: Optional. Video width

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.Height
member.summary: Optional. Video height

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.Caption
member.summary: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultPhoto
member.summary: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can provide message_text to send it instead of photo.

member.summary: A valid URL of the photo. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

member.summary: Optional. MIME type of the photo, defaults to image/jpeg

member.summary: Optional. Width of the photo

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultPhoto.Height
member.summary: Optional. Height of the photo

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultPhoto.Description
member.summary: Optional. Short description of the result

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultPhoto.Caption
member.summary: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.InlineQueryResultType
member.summary: Type of the InlineQueryResult

member.summary: Optional. Video width

member.summary: Optional. Video duration in seconds

member.summary: Conversation the message belongs to

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.ForwardFrom
member.summary: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.ForwardDate
member.summary: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.ReplyToMessage
member.summary: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

member.summary: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

member.summary: Message is a voice message, information about the file

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.Caption
member.summary: Caption for the photo or video

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.Contact
member.summary: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.Location
member.summary: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.NewChatParticipant
member.summary: Optional. A new member was added to the group, information about them (this member may be bot itself)

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.LeftChatParticipant
member.summary: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be bot itself)

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.NewChatTitle
member.summary: Optional. A group title was changed to this value

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.NewChatPhoto
member.summary: Optional. A group photo was change to this value

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.DeleteChatPhoto
member.summary: Optional. Informs that the group photo was deleted

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.GroupChatCreated
member.summary: Optional. Informs that the group has been created

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.SupergroupChatCreated
member.summary: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.ChannelChatCreated
member.summary: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.MigrateToChatId
member.summary: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Message.MigrateFromChatId
member.summary: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.MessageType
member.summary: The type of a Message

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ParseMode
member.summary: Text parsing mode

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.PhotoSize
member.summary: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.
member.remarks: A missing thumbnail for a file (or sticker) is presented as an empty object.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.PhotoSize.Width
member.summary: Photo width

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.PhotoSize.Height
member.summary: Photo height

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardHide
member.summary: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will hide the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardHide.HideKeyboard
member.summary: Requests clients to hide the custom keyboard

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardMarkup
member.summary: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardMarkup.Keyboard
member.summary: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of Strings

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardMarkup.ResizeKeyboard
member.summary: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyKeyboardMarkup.OneTimeKeyboard
member.summary: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.ReplyMarkup.Selective
member.summary: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message. Example: A user requests to change the bot‘s language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language.Other users in the group don’t see the keyboard.

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Sticker
member.summary: This object represents a sticker.

member.summary: Sticker width

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Sticker.Height
member.summary: Sticker height

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Sticker.Thumb
member.summary: Sticker thumbnail in .webp or .jpg format

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.Update
member.summary: This object represents an incoming update.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Update.Id
member.summary: The update‘s unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you’re using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Update.Message
member.summary: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Update.InlineQuery
member.summary: Optional. New incoming inline query

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.Update.ChosenInlineResult
member.summary: Optional. The result of a inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner

member.name: T:Telegram.Bot.Types.UpdateType
member.summary: The type of an Update

member.summary: Optional. User‘s or bot’s last name

member.name: P:Telegram.Bot.Types.User.Username
